info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 10 at 6:55AM CDT until May 12 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Navasota River near Normangee affecting Brazos, Madison and Grimes Counties.
For the Navasota River...including Normangee...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Navasota River near Normangee.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to early Monday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water escapes the main channel and inundates the floodplain.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 14.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 15.2 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.2 feet on 05/22/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/hgx.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Brazos, TX; Grimes, TX; Madison, TX
